page.title: 02LINTON VILLAGE
page.content: Linton lies south west of Swadlincote about 5 miles from Burton upon Trent. It is a straggling village with a population of around 3,000 people.The growth of the village was due to the opening of the local collieries all of which are now closed.Linton is very rural.Housing is mixed between council & private dwellings.The focal points in the village are chiefly the 3 pubs & the village hall,with the chipshop & the main bus stop attracting large numbers of young people.The village 'rec'is a favourite for children & the new hard court area is very popular. The village also has several organisations ranging from W.I.,Young Wives,Darby & Joan,Football,Cricket & Youth Clubs.Dances,Bingo & other activeites take place in the village hall.There are 2 places of worship, Christ Church & the Methodist Chapel.
